titlestmt.titleproper: American Association for Clinical Chemistry records 1948-2001
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Association for Clinical Chemistry records

bioghist.p: The American Association for Clinical Chemistry (AACC) is an international scientific/medical society of clinical laboratory professionals, physicians, research scientists and other individuals involved with clinical chemistry and clinical laboratory science disciplines. Founded in 1948, the society has 9,500 members and is headquartered in Washington, DC. AACC is subdivided geographically into 22 local sections. Samuel Meites (b. 1921) was Professor of Pediatrics at the Ohio State University College of Medicine and head of Clinical Chemistry at Children's Hospital of Columbus, Ohio. He was the chair of the History Division of the American Association for Clinical Chemistry (AACC). In 1989, his biography of Otto Folin was published by the AACC. Walter J. Frajola was Professor Emeritus in the Department of Physiological Chemistry at Ohio State University. Frajola was a member of the Ohio Valley Section of the AACC and was chairman of the AACC Endowment Fund for Research in Clinical Chemistry. Wendell T. Caraway (1920-2001) was a Clinical Biochemist at McLaren General and St. Joseph Hospitals in Flint, Michigan. He served as AACC president in 1965-66 and supported the Caraway Endowment Fund which is used by the History Division to support its activities related to the history of the field.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes AACC materials compiled by several individuals. The Walter Frajola materials consist of records of the AACC Endowment Fund for Research in Clinical Chemistry (1977-1995), including: incoming and outgoing correspondence (1979-1989); minutes and records of fundraising committee activities; some records from the Van Slyke Society, AACC's philanthropic branch; records of contributions; and other administrative documents. The Wendell Caraway materials consist of photocopies of Executive Committee minutes (1948-1958) and copies and a few originals of AACC's newsletter, the Clinical Chemist (1949-1954). The Samuel Meites materials include: correspondence, minutes, newsletters, financial reports, and by-laws from the AACC Division of the History of Clinical Chemistry (1990-1998); AACC meeting programs (1980-2001); records from the Folin/Van Slyke postage stamp campaign; photographs, negatives, and proofsheets for Meites's biography of Otto Folin; correspondence and minutes from the Committee on Pediatric Clinical Chemistry; and other miscellaneous AACC records.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Dr. Wendell T. Caraway (accession 1); Dr. Sam Meites (accessions 2); Dr. Walter J. Frajola (accession 3)

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Chemical Heritage Foundation: American Association for Clinical Chemistry Standards Committee records (01:40); Samuel Meites papers (01:02); Raymond E. Vanderlinde papers (00:31).
